Curtis L. Jones

 
 
  • Republican Party
    •

Curtis L. Jones is running for Lakesite City Commission
Back to races

Bio

I was born at Erlanger 11/21/1954 and lived in Hixson growing up. I bought my first home in Lakesite in 1980, where I live now. I was a carpenter for 12 years (local union 74) before becoming an instrument mechanic for TVA with training from Chattanooga State. I just recently retired from TVA as a senior instrument mechanic.

More info

Why do you want to run for public office?

A few months ago, the commission had voted 3 to 2 for installing sewers in Lakesite and this proposal got more people to the next meeting than ever before. I went to this meeting and several since then. I felt like the ones who voted to put the sewers in were not in touch with the residents of Lakesite. I am hoping to stop this click by replacing one of the 3 who voted for the sewer installation.

Please identify three issues that are important to you as a candidate.

Integrity is first.
Staying in touch with the residents and their issues.
What are we spending our tax dollars on.

If elected, how would you address those issues?

Integrity is easy...don't lie, it's easy to remember the truth.

I will contact residents and get their email address(if they have them) and send them updates of what is going on.

I have heard a few things from going to the meetings, but will do research and talk with the other council members along with residents to make decisions at council meetings, if elected.

About this guide

There are more than 60 candidates and ballot measures in Hamilton County's Nov. 4 election. Over the past few weeks, Nooga.com sent the candidates brief surveys to help voters get a better understanding of the people who want to represent them in federal, state and local governments.
